title: 103_hr2424
content: The Ukrainian American Veterans, Incorporated, organized under the laws of New York, is granted a Federal charter with specific powers outlined in its bylaws and articles of incorporation. The corporation's purposes, as outlined in its articles of incorporation, include preserving the Constitution, honoring veterans, promoting understanding of sacrifices, raising awareness about veteran issues, and preserving records of patriotic service. The corporation aims to preserve the Constitution, honor veterans, promote understanding of sacrifices, raise awareness about veteran issues, and preserve records of patriotic service. Additionally, it fosters the association of veterans of Ukrainian descent who have served in the Armed Forces of the United States. The corporation aims to honor veterans, promote understanding of sacrifices, raise awareness about veteran issues, and preserve records of patriotic service. Additionally, it fosters the association of veterans of Ukrainian descent who have served in the Armed Forces of the United States. SEC. 8. RESTRICTIONS. The corporation is prohibited from distributing income or assets to members, officers, or directors. Reasonable compensation and reimbursement for expenses are allowed. Loans to any member, officer, director, or employee are not permitted. Political activity and attempts to influence legislation are also prohibited. The corporation cannot issue stock or pay dividends. The corporation is prohibited from distributing income or assets to members, officers, or directors. It cannot issue stock, pay dividends, or claim Federal approval. It must maintain its status as a corporation organized under the laws of New York and function as an educational, patriotic, civic, and historical organization. The corporation is liable for the acts of its officers, directors, employees, and agents when they act within their authority. Maintenance and inspection of books and records are required. SEC. 10. The corporation must maintain correct and complete books and records of account, including minutes of proceedings involving members, the board of directors, or relevant committees. It must also keep a record of members' names and addresses at its principal office. Members have the right to inspect the books and records for any proper purpose. No provision in this section can go against applicable State law. SEC. 11. Financial transactions are subject to audit. SEC. 11. Audit of financial transactions for Ukrainian American Veterans, Incorporated. SEC. 12. Annual report to Congress on corporation activities. SEC. 13. Congress reserves right to amend or repeal this Act. SEC. 14. Definitions. SEC. 14. DEFINITIONS. The term "corporation" refers to the Ukrainian American Veterans, Incorporated, and the term "State" includes various territories and possessions of the United States. SEC. 15. TAX EXEMPT STATUS. The corporation must maintain its tax-exempt status as per the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. SEC. 16. TERMINATION. The charter granted in this Act will expire if the corporation fails to comply with any provisions of this Act.
